title: Accountant
job_overview:
We are seeking highly organised and detail-oriented Accountants to join our company, one of the largest international manufacturers of Water Control Solutions. This role involves managing and overseeing day-to-day financial transactions, supporting month-end and year-end reporting, and ensuring compliance with Australian accounting standards.

The role collaborates with cross-functional teams to drive financial accuracy and deliver insights that inform strategic decisions.

Key Responsibilities:

Prepare and review general ledger entries, reconciliations, and journal adjustments
Manage accounts payable and receivable processes, ensuring timely invoicing and payments
Review and assist with payroll systems and support the Senior Accountant with reconciliations or ad-hoc reporting
Coordinate and execute month-end and year-end close activities, including financial statement preparation
Monitor cash flow, budgeting, and forecasting activities; provide variance analyses
Ensure compliance with AASB, Taxation Administration Act, GST, and other relevant legislation
Support audit processes by providing schedules, analyses, and documentation
Liaise with external advisors, including auditors, tax agents, and financial institutions
Identify process improvement opportunities within the finance function

Qualifications and Certifications:

Qualified Certified Public Accountant
With Senior Accountant role experience 
Demonstrated continuing professional development in accounting standards and taxation 

Skills and Competencies:

Advanced proficiency in accounting software (e.g. Xero, MYOB, QuickBooks) and MS Excel
Knowledge and experience in Australian payroll processes
Strong analytical skills with an eye for accuracy and detail
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to manage multiple tasks, meet deadlines, and work independently
Sound understanding of Australian taxation laws, payroll, and superannuation requirements
Collaborative mindset with stakeholder management capabilities

Experience:

Minimum of 5 years of experience in an industry accounting or finance role 
Solid experience working with Australian clients in a commercial accounting role, preferably in the manufacturing industry
Proven track record of managing full-cycle accounting processes
Exposure to audit engagements and financial reporting under the Australian Accounting Standards

Tools and Software Experience:

MS Excel
Microsoft 365
Xero, MYOB, QuickBooks
